leaf: Evaluate for medical versus surgical management. If hCG falls, follow until less than assay
paths: Evaluate patient for possible ectopic pregnancy -> Determine if the patient is stable or unstable -> Patient is stable -> Perform physical examination, transvaginal US, quantitative β-hCG, CBC, blood type and antibody screen, and serum progesterone level -> Check US results -> Ectopic pregnancy confirmed by US -> Evaluate for medical versus surgical management. If hCG falls, follow until less than assay||Evaluate patient for possible ectopic pregnancy -> Determine if the patient is stable or unstable -> Patient is stable -> Perform physical examination, transvaginal US, quantitative β-hCG, CBC, blood type and antibody screen, and serum progesterone level -> Check US results -> Pregnancy location not confirmed by US -> Check hCG and progesterone levels -> High hCG or low progesterone -> Abnormal pregnancy: perform D&C -> Ectopic pregnancy confirmed -> Evaluate for medical versus surgical management. If hCG falls, follow until less than assay||Evaluate patient for possible ectopic pregnancy -> Determine if the patient is stable or unstable -> Patient is stable -> Perform physical examination, transvaginal US, quantitative β-hCG, CBC, blood type and antibody screen, and serum progesterone level -> Check US results -> Pregnancy location not confirmed by US -> Check hCG and progesterone levels -> Low hCG and high progesterone -> Repeat hCG in 48 hr -> hCG increases by less than 50% -> Abnormal pregnancy: perform D&C -> Ectopic pregnancy confirmed -> Evaluate for medical versus surgical management. If hCG falls, follow until less than assay

Evaluate patient for possible ectopic pregnancy -> Determine if the patient is stable or unstable -> Patient is stable -> Perform physical examination, transvaginal US, quantitative β-hCG, CBC, blood type and antibody screen, and serum progesterone level -> Check US results -> Pregnancy location not confirmed by US -> Check hCG and progesterone levels -> Low hCG and high progesterone -> Repeat hCG in 48 hr -> hCG decreases -> Monitor hCG levels

Evaluate patient for possible ectopic pregnancy -> Determine if the patient is stable or unstable -> Patient is stable -> Perform physical examination, transvaginal US, quantitative β-hCG, CBC, blood type and antibody screen, and serum progesterone level -> Check US results -> Pregnancy location not confirmed by US -> Check hCG and progesterone levels -> Low hCG and high progesterone -> Repeat hCG in 48 hr -> hCG increases by more than 50% -> Monitor and repeat US

Evaluate patient for possible ectopic pregnancy -> Determine if the patient is stable or unstable -> Patient is stable -> Perform physical examination, transvaginal US, quantitative β-hCG, CBC, blood type and antibody screen, and serum progesterone level -> Check US results -> Intrauterine pregnancy confirmed by US

Evaluate patient for possible ectopic pregnancy -> Determine if the patient is stable or unstable -> Patient is unstable (hypotension, tachycardia, orthostasis, or acute abdomen pain) -> Proceed with immediate surgical management
